alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:05PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henry, southern Clay and northwestern Early Counties through 545 PM EDT/445 PM CDT/... At 505 PM EDT/405 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Abbeville to near Columbia. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Headland, Blakely, Columbia, Newville, Bellville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Tumbleton, Grandberry Crossroads, Hayes, Pecan, Rock Hill, Graball, Headland Municipal A/P, Dancey and Early Co A/p. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
